features: Western Digital WD4000FYYZ ENTERPRISE 4TB 7200RPM 64MB Cache SATA 6.0Gb/s 3.5 internal hard drive
body.description: Western Digital 4TB WD4000FYYZ RE SATA 6.0Gb/s 3.5" Enterprise Hard Drive from WD is a powerful combination of enterprise-class performance and high capacity required for superior performance computing and business critical environments. The hard drive delivers transfer rates of up to 6 Gbps and high random I/O rates. It is coupled with a dual processor, which provides twice the processing power to maximize performance. The WD RE SATA Hard Drive's enhanced RAFF technology monitors the drive and corrects both linear and rotational vibration in real-time. It thus provides optimum performance even in high vibration environments. It features a head positioning system with two actuators which improves positional accuracy over the data track(s). The multi-axis shock sensor feature automatically detects the subtlest shock events allowing you to protect the data. The WD RE SATA Hard Drive's Time-Limited Error Recovery (TLER) feature prevents drive fall-out caused by the extended hard drive error-recovery processes. The NoTouch ramp load technology ensures that the recording head never touches the disk media. This allows significantly less wear to the recording head and media as well as enhanced drive protection in transit. Dynamic fly height technology enables each read-write head's fly height to be adjusted in real-time for optimum reliability. With 64 MB cache, the WD RE SATA Hard Drive ensures faster data transactions. It is ideal for use in servers, video surveillance and other demanding write-intensive applications demanding write-intensive applications. High Performance for Business Critical Applications The hard drive delivers transfer rates of up to 6 Gbps

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Good hard drive overall
reviews.reviewText: Definitely have plenty of space love this hard drive awesome product have no complaints

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Good value, failed 10 days after install
reviews.reviewText: Usually I have good luck with Western Digital products, but not this time. Drive failed after after 10 days. Could only recover a portion of the data before completely failing. Got

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good drive, excellent value
reviews.reviewText: Like any unformatted drive, you will need to format and get everything setup before using it. Lots of YouTube videos to help out there. The install itself was as easy as plugging in the SATA cord and power. Your case determines how easy that is. Then secure the drive in your case. Literally less than 10 minutes for my case and it only took that long because I made the wires look nice.The drive works very well. It accesses quickly. The only slight complaint is the drive is somewhat noisy you will hear the clicking as it reads and writes. Part of that is the mounting in my case, part of that is the rest of the computer is almost silent. In a normal case and anywhere there are noisy or background drone from fans, you will not hear it in most instances.The storage capacity is excellent and I will buy at least one more for all the videos we produce.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars good drive if you have a cooling fan, not as noisy as seagate
reviews.reviewText: happy with it, just gets hot after copying tons of files. Use a fan blowing air on it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fast delivery good price exactly what I was looking for
reviews.reviewText: Worked out great was being used for recording Cell cameras.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It's a bit loud and that's something to consider if you're deploying this into a computer that needs to be low noise. Access and read/write speeds are very good. These black labeled business class drives have internal components that are supposed to outlast most of the blue and red labeled retail WD drives, as they're intended for more constant use in a low end server or NAS. My last WD black enterprise drive was 7 years old before it started failing, and that was used mildly as a data drive daily.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Ordered a bunch of these for a FreeNAS build in a couple of batches. One batch got stuck on a FedEx belt somewhere in Orlando and arrived late and nonfunctional; had to reorder that batch (seller didn't offer replacement, just refund). Out of the other drives one died in less than a week... trying to work with the seller now.I ordered another batch a year or so ago and haven't had any trouble with those.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars These are NOT new drives - Refurbs or returns
reviews.reviewText: Got a used drive with over 4 years of power on hours. Ordered in Dec 2023, manufacturing date on the drive is 2015. In sealed packaging but clearly used or refurbed based on the drive SMART tests. Buyer beware

reviews.reviewTitle: Noisy but cost-effective for an enterprise grade HDD
reviews.reviewText: Pretty noisy. However, I use it as my data backup disk only, installed in an external USB disk enclosure. Hence it's not an issue. very happy to get a 4TB drive at this price point.
